text: Hi everyone, I'm Vanessa and while I'm used to developing web apps and sites from scratch, our client already has a fully featured HubSpot account and we are going to try to seize all of it's potential to build their website. I'll try my best to post any questions in the correct channels. Thank you for accepting me!
Welcome to the community <@UH0EC1SCQ> - We're really excited to have you :sprocket::bmo:
WOOT WOOT - awesome to have you a part of our community <@UH52DMK3Q> :hamsterdance::clapping:

Welcome to the community <@UH36ZQSD9> - we're really happy to have you a part of it.

I would suggest checking out the new CMS for Developers certification - there is a class specifically on HubL : <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-for-developers>

Also you can read, ask questions, and collaborate in <#C2YH119N2|hubl>
WOOT WOOT - well, you already have a lot of friends here <@UH67QP59T> :bmo::bmo::bmo: We're excited to have you a part of our CMS developer community!

Welcome <@UH7FRQQNR> - we're very excited to have you a part of the HubSpot developer community! :bmo:

The HubSpot CMS has a little learning curve, but once it clicks (specifically our templating language <#C2YH119N2|hubl> and simple database system <#C22PDRW72|data-driven-content>) ... You'll get going quickly. :slightly_smiling_face:

I would suggest checking out:
> - The Developer Discovery Kit: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/discoverykit>
> - The (new) CMS for Developers Certification: <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-for-developers>

And ask lots of questions in this slack. :slightly_smiling_face: Lots of devs happy to help out!
